meanings.definition: Peregrines (noun): a type of falcon known for its swift flight
meanings.sent1: The peregrines soared high in the sky, hunting for prey.
meanings.sent2: Birdwatchers gathered to catch a glimpse of the majestic peregrines in flight.
meanings.sent3: The peregrines decided to have a race with the sparrows, much to the amusement of the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like that of the peregrines, swift and focused.
meanings.sent5: The image of the peregrines diving towards their target was etched in his memory.

meanings.definition: Peregrines (verb): to travel or wander from place to place
meanings.sent1: After retiring, they planned to peregrine across Europe, exploring new cultures.
meanings.sent2: The nomadic tribe would peregrine through the desert in search of water and shelter.
meanings.sent3: The lost dog seemed to peregrine aimlessly around the neighborhood, much to the amusement of the residents.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts would peregrine back to the memories of her childhood, wandering through the fields.
meanings.sent5: The river peregrines through the valleys, carving its path through the landscape.
